basics.name: Hau'olinalani O'Brien
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Aloha mai! I'm Hau'oli, a Hawaiian-American girl from O'ahu, Hawai'i. I'm part of the University of Hawai'is Class of 2026 and I am currently pursuing my Bachelor of Science in Computer Science. I love to learn anything related to Computer Science alongside anything that perpetuates our tech world as we know it.

work.summary: Student Lead for Autonomous Rover Technological Components
highlights: Developed code in C++ on an Arduino Nano Microcontroller to allow an autonomous rover to traverse a terrain with predetermined range and coordinates.
Streamlined our rover execution by designing, implementing and testing the code base, which provided the metrics for our automation platform.
Create lessons rooted in STEM and Computer Science to present to the students.
The goal of supplemental teaching is to instill and prepetuate Computer Science and Technology to students K-12.

volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Prepetuation, maintainance, and cultivation of Native Hawaiian culture through volunteerism.
Preserve Native Hawaiian Heritage through cultural site maintainance, hosting activies and classes to learn different traditions from each other, and establish Native plant habitats.
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: Bow Yee Tong Scholarship for Chinese Women
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to High school seniors of Chinese heritage that are pursuing an education in STEM fields.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015. See my portfolio site for more details.
